intro: Casearia mindanaensis, commonly known as Mindanao casearia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in lowland and montane forests, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
